marketNews.title: Grup Prajogo Pangestu Buyback Rp5 Trillion
marketNews.content: Companies owned by Prajogo Pangestu are preparing a total fund of up to IDR 5 trillion for share buyback between 24 March and 23 June 2025. The plan will not be discussed at the General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS), following the relaxation issued by the Financial Services Authority (OJK) to support capital market stability. The relaxation allows issuers to conduct buybacks without RUPS approval for a period of six months starting 18 March 2025. The detailed buyback allocations for each company are provided in the accompanying tables. Key Takeaway: The share buyback actions may indicate confidence of Prajogo Pangestu-owned issuers in their fundamentals or value. While the purchases could boost optimism among some market participants and provide support for the IDX Composite (IHSG), we assess that an increase in investor confidence—especially from foreign investors—is required for a more significant IHSG recovery.

marketNews.title: Komisi XI DPR Chairman Calls for Strengthening Bank Indonesia Role
marketNews.content: Chairman of Commission XI of the House of Representatives, Mukhamad Misbakhun, said on Friday (21 March) that his side has prepared measures to strengthen the role of Bank Indonesia so that it can help the government achieve an economic growth target of plus 8 percent. He did not detail how Bank Indonesia's role could be enhanced, and no decision has been taken yet. The DPR is currently discussing Law No. 4/2023 on the development and strengthening of the financial sector, which raises concerns that the amendment could weaken Bank Indonesia's independence. Previously, Governor of Bank Indonesia Perry Warjiyo acknowledged that there were talks about the central bank's mandate in parliamentary discussions, but he expected no changes regarding that matter.

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister Plans to Raise Nickel and Gold Royalties
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said on Thursday (20 March) that the government plans to increase nickel and gold royalties by approximately 1.5 to 3 percentage points, although he did not provide further details. Earlier this month, the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources held a public consultation on a draft amendment to mineral and coal (minerba) royalties tariffs.

marketNews.title: Danantara CEO Announces Full Management Structure
marketNews.content: CEO of BPI Danantara and Minister of Investment and Inward Investment, Rosan Roeslani, said on Friday (21 March) that the complete management structure filling key positions at Danantara will be announced on Monday (24 March) afternoon, although he did not provide further details. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto announced the leadership of Danantara at the end of February 2025, together with the launch of the agency.

marketNews.title: Hang Seng China Enterprises Index Falls -2.3%
marketNews.content: The Hang Seng China Enterprises Index closed down 2.3 percent on Friday (21 March), resulting in a two-day decline of 4.6 percent, the sharpest drop since 9 October 2024. According to Bloomberg, analysts attribute the decline to a lack of new catalysts, noting that the index appears to have been priced in after the Chinese government earlier this month pledged to support economic expansion and artificial intelligence development.

tickerNews.title: BBRI February 2025 Net Profit +42% YoY, +129% MoM
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) recorded net profit (bank only) of IDR 4.6 trillion in February 2025, up 42 percent year-on-year and 129 percent month-on-month, a significant recovery from January 2025. This result caused the bank-only net profit for the first two months of 2025 to fall 18 percent YoY to IDR 6.6 trillion, worse than the consensus estimate of a 1.3 percent YoY decline for consolidated 2025F, due to a management overlay in January 2025. February 2025 net profit growth was driven by a sharp reduction in provision expenses to IDR 3.3 trillion, down 49 percent YoY and 41 percent MoM, reflected in the bank-only cost of credit (CoC) easing to 3.28 percent (vs. Jan 2025: 5.57 percent, Feb 2024: 6.72 percent). Operating profit (PPOP) fell 11 percent YoY in February 2025 because of a surge in labor costs (+91 percent YoY). Net interest margin (NIM) for the bank only remained stable at 6.39 percent in February 2025 (vs. Feb 2024: 6.17 percent, Jan 2025: 6.15 percent). Meanwhile, credit and financing growth for the bank only increased 5.2 percent YoY over the first two months of 2025 (vs. 2M24: +12.6 percent YoY, 1M25: +4.6 percent YoY), with the loan-to-deposit ratio staying high at 88.2 percent.

tickerNews.title: AMRT 4Q24 Net Profit 749 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT) reported net profit of IDR 749 billion for 4Q24, down 38 percent YoY but up 24 percent quarter-on-quarter. The result made the 2024 net profit total IDR 3.1 trillion, an 8 percent YoY decline, below expectations at 81 percent of the consensus 2024F estimate. Revenue in 4Q24 grew to IDR 30 trillion, up 11 percent YoY and 3 percent QoQ, bringing 2024 revenue to IDR 118.2 trillion, up 11 percent YoY. The weak operating profit in 4Q24 (down 37 percent YoY, up 24 percent QoQ) was caused by an increase in opex-to-sales to 19.2 percent (vs. 4Q23: 18.2 percent, 3Q24: 19.3 percent), reducing the operating profit margin to 3.2 percent (vs. 4Q23: 5.8 percent, 3Q24: 2.7 percent).

tickerNews.title: ELSA 4Q24 Net Profit 162 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Elnusa (ELSA) reported net profit of IDR 162 billion for 4Q24, up 50 percent QoQ and 68 percent YoY. This result made the 2024 net profit total IDR 714 billion, up 42 percent YoY, surpassing our expectation in the Unboxing ELSA analysis (106.8 percent FY24F Stockbit estimate). The quarterly net profit increase was mainly driven by the reversal of other-income, especially the reversal of foreign exchange gains from a loss of IDR 68 billion in 3Q24 to a gain of IDR 44 billion in 4Q24. Operationally, revenue grew 12.2 percent QoQ, but gross profit margin fell 160 basis points QoQ to 8.5 percent and operating expenses rose 34 percent QoQ, causing operating profit to decline 29.9 percent QoQ.

tickerNews.title: BREN 4Q24 Net Profit 36 Million USD
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewable Energy (BREN) reported net profit of USD 36 million for 4Q24, up 57 percent YoY and 28 percent QoQ, making the 2024 net profit total USD 122 million, up 14 percent YoY. The quarterly net profit increase was mainly driven by a reduction in net financial expenses to USD 28 million (down 11 percent YoY, down 7 percent QoQ) following refinancing in September 2024, and a foreign exchange gain of USD 2 million (4Q23: loss of USD 4 million, 3Q24: loss of USD 2 million). According to Stockbit calculations, BREN's EBITDA reached USD 132 million in 4Q24 (up 7 percent YoY, up 5 percent QoQ), resulting in 2024 EBITDA of USD 502 million (up 1 percent YoY).

tickerNews.title: PGAS 2M25 Gas Sales Volume 868 BBtud
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) recorded gas sales volume of 868 billion British thermal units (BBtud) for the first two months of 2025, unchanged YoY, about 1 to 9 percent below the 2025 target range of 873-958 BBtud. Meanwhile, gas transmission volume reached 1,569 million standard cubic feet per day (MMSCFD), up 12 percent YoY for the first two months of 2025, exceeding the 2025 target of 1,435 MMSCFD by 9 percent. Upstream oil and gas product sales volume amounted to 16,937 barrels of oil equivalent per day (BOEPD), down 26 percent YoY for the first two months of 2025, 2 percent below the 2025 target of 17,227 BOEPD.

tickerNews.title: HEAL 4Q24 Net Profit 68 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) reported net profit of IDR 68 billion for 4Q24, down 24 percent YoY and 46 percent QoQ. This result made the 2024 net profit total IDR 536 billion, up 23 percent YoY, but below expectations at 92 percent of the consensus 2024F estimate. Operationally, revenue in 4Q24 grew modestly by 9 percent YoY and 0.5 percent QoQ, while margins remained flat (gross profit margin up 10 basis points YoY, operating profit margin down 10 basis points YoY). Annual net profit for 4Q24 was pressured by higher financial expenses of IDR 49 billion (vs. 4Q23: IDR 28 billion), causing net profit margin to fall 169 basis points YoY. In a separate information disclosure, the controlling shareholder and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Hasmoro, purchased approximately 2.4 million HEAL shares at an average price of IDR 1,255.1 per share on 17-18 March 2025.

tickerNews.title: ERAA Share Purchase by PT Eralink International
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Erajaya Swasembada, PT Eralink International, purchased approximately 39.4 million ERAA shares at an average price of about IDR 372 per share on 18-19 March 2025. The total transaction value was around IDR 14.7 billion. After this transaction, PT Eralink International's ownership in ERAA increased from 54.93 percent to 55.17 percent.

tickerNews.title: MIDI 4Q24 Net Profit 80 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Midi Utama Indonesia (MIDI) reported net profit of IDR 80 billion for 4Q24, down 37 percent YoY and 44 percent QoQ. This result made the 2024 net profit total IDR 546 billion, up 6 percent YoY, but below expectations at 92 percent of the consensus 2024F estimate. Revenue in 4Q24 grew to IDR 5.2 trillion, up 17 percent YoY and 6 percent QoQ, bringing 2024 revenue to IDR 19.9 trillion, up 15 percent YoY. The weak operating profit in 4Q24 (down 35 percent YoY, down 40 percent QoQ) was caused by an increase in opex-to-sales to 24.4 percent (vs. 4Q23: 24 percent, 3Q24: 24 percent), reducing the operating profit margin to 2.1 percent (vs. 4Q23: 3.9 percent, 3Q24: 3.8 percent).

tickerNews.title: ULTJ Planned Share Buyback up to 10% of Paid-up Capital
tickerNews.content: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company (ULTJ) plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 10 percent of its paid-up capital, costing approximately IDR 1.7 trillion, between 24 March and 23 June 2025. The plan does not require RUPS approval, following the relaxation granted by OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Share Purchase by PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC), PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa, purchased approximately 65.8 million IMPC shares at a price of IDR 304 per share on 20 March 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 20 billion. After the transaction, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa's ownership in IMPC increased from 44.99 percent to 45.11 percent.

tickerNews.title: BJTM 4Q24 Net Profit ~367 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur (BJTM) reported net profit of approximately IDR 367 billion for 4Q24, down 2.4 percent YoY but up 19 percent QoQ, resulting in a 2024 net profit of about IDR 1.3 trillion, down 12 percent YoY. The 4Q24 net profit was pressured by a sharp increase in provision expenses to about IDR 577 billion (vs. 4Q23: about IDR 239 billion, 3Q24: about IDR 209 billion). On the top line, BJTM recorded net interest income (NII) growth to about IDR 1.7 trillion in 4Q24, up 22 percent YoY and QoQ. In an analyst meeting on Thursday (20 March), BJTM announced a plan to issue bonds worth IDR 5 trillion in 2025-2026, with the 2025 tranche scheduled for issuance in August or September.

tickerNews.title: GULA Share Sale by Director Andreas Utomo
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder and President Director of Aman Agrindo (GULA), Andreas Utomo, sold approximately 21.6 million GULA shares at a price of IDR 324 per share on 19 March 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 7 billion and was intended for an investment strategy. After the transaction, Andreas's ownership in GULA decreased from 17.49 percent to 15.47 percent.

tickerNews.title: SRIL Receives New Investor and Plans to Rehire 5,000 Workers
tickerNews.content: Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) has obtained a new investor and will resume operations in the near future. The Head of the Industry and Employment Office of Sukoharjo Regency, Sumarno, said that 5,000 former employees have been recruited for the company's operations with the new investor. The Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, confirmed that the former SRIL employees signed employment contracts with the investor on Monday (17 March). Previously, SRIL ceased operations on 1 March 2025 after the Semarang Commercial Court placed SRIL in bankruptcy status due to a lawsuit from PT Indo Bharat Rayon.
